newsitem.title: USA: Motorola to sell Nicaraguan cellular stake.
newsitem.headline: Motorola to sell Nicaraguan cellular stake.

text.p: Motorola Inc said its Network Management Group agreed to sell its stake in Telefonia Celular de Nicaragua, a Nicaraguan wireless telephone company, to BellSouth Corp.
Terms were not disclosed. Motorola has been a shareholder in Telefonia Celular de Nicaragua since its inception in 1993.
"BellSouth made us a good financial offer and our decision to sell to them will allow us to rebalance our worldwide portfolio of investments," said Michael Norris, Motorola corporate vice president.

Norris added that Motorola's Network Management Group remains committed to the Latin American market with cellular ventures in Mexico, Honduras, Dominican Republic and Chile, plus two joint ventures in partnership with BellSouth, one in Argentina, the other in Uruguay.
Motorola's Network Management Group participates in cellular operating company joint ventures in 18 countries, with more than 3.5 million customers worldwide.
